alert.note: Alert for St Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 04 at 9:36PM AST until February 06 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM AST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...The island of St Croix. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM AST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions, localized beach erosion and minor coastal flooding. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
